intro: Luma distoma, commonly known as the Christmas tree fern, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Cyatheaceae family and is characterized by its tall, tree-like structure with a thick, fibrous trunk. The plant has large, pinnate fronds that can grow up to several meters in length, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. The fronds are used in traditional medicine and as ornamental plants in horticulture.
